title: Bedtime Stories for Lonesome Darling
text:
Older Southern gentleman, lifelong bachelor; I have had many beautiful girl friends over the years who all would say I have NEVER cheated on a girlfriend in my life. Moral compass. 

A little bit of a nutrition and fitness nut. I am 6'2", the same weight 180 lbs., and body I was when I tried out for the corner at an elite college football program at age 19 (pic after football camp attached). I can out last most guys in their 30's. Girl trainers, fitness models, and nutrition nuts follow me on Pinterest and Twitter. Women my age BORE me; I would rather be alone than be with someone I have no interest in.

I have been "Discrete Friend" to girls 19 to 28 or at least have 4 in the past 10 years who have also become BEST FRIENDS. My latest, from when she was 19 to 22, graduated last June and teaching abroad while working on her Masters in Spanish. Our planned graduation left me with an empty heart.

I met her when she saw me giving an investment presentation. She began calling and asking questions, odd for a 19-year-old, but I was nice and patient as she called just to chat. 

I became her virtual lover. . . during the day she would text, call, email. . . like lovers do and every night for over 2 years I told her a bedtime story. 

Simply seek to be close with a girl who has not yet lost her sense of wonder and wants a man to talk to who only seeks her happiness. Tell her a bedtime story every night to assure her Sweet Dreams.

title: email pal
text:
Honestly, you location doesn't really matter, it is what is inside that counts. But, I am quirky, and I am okay with that and hope you are too. I like things in common and age within 5 years. Nothing wrong with wanting someone to correspond with that has your same interests. Here are the things I would like to talk about with a penpal:

1. You are single, I am as well. I don't want to disrespect anyone involved. Around my age range, within 5 years.
2. Love of the outdoors, nothing better than being with Mother Nature and loving a ski trip, a run, a bike, a hike, a kayak, a boat, anything outside.
3. A good drink, a night by the fire with a good wine or a great beer is good.
4. A superhero outfit, you never know when you will need one.
5. A good education and a good job. This is one of the things I value in my life that is up on the top. Prob #3.
6. Enjoying the moment.
7. Random yard ornaments. Gazing balls, solar lights, bird baths, shiny things are so darn cool.
8. Random thoughts and acts of kindness, 4 out of 5 voices in my head told me to post this. 
9. A getaway car. 
10. I am not looking for a meetup. That's why I posted in strictly platonic. No pics are necessary, just a like mind.
11. Eleven is from heaven, tell me about yourself. I won't respond to a "Hello" especially after I spent the time to create this post.

Let me know your superhero outfit!

title: Expanding of Friendship Horizons
text:
Hi there, =) 
I am a 23 yr old lesbian looking for friends in the area. I've been in the area for three years now. Right now I'm in the process of self improving and have decided that not being in a relationship is detrimental to the process. I just left a 2 yr relationship and was very distraught doing so but it was do to my personal failings. Thankfully we are still friends and have a ton of love for each other. Right now she is my only friend in Colorado. I think it would be healthy for me to branch out and know more people during this transition in life.

I've always had great expectations for myself and won't be happy until I feel fulfilled. I want that lust for life and hopefully I meet like minded people. 
I've lived a dangerous and unpredictable life but that's behind me (thankfully). I'm striving to be the best self I can. 
Now with that being said, I work a lot and wouldn't be around all of the time but I keep an open ear for friends and am not that far away. I'm pretty political for the most part. Stong opinions but not pushy. I'm into everything outdoors. Can't say I'm very good for shopping. Movies are OK but not usually entertaining, more of a documentary kind of girl. I'm seriously level headed so if you need a grounder, I'm your gal. Don't think I'm super bland, I've got whit to boot ;) can be a complete riot.

title: Let's Sync up.
text:
t has been said that the whole is more than the sum of it's parts. Synergism is what I desire in a personal relationship with a woman. I wish to be more than a stunted part of a stale entity. I see each of us as a cracking element of a synergistic event. Somewhere there is such a woman worthy of both my trust and admiration. I have dedicated my life to be such a man, capable of lending my strength and honoring that which is best between us. A man is made of many thing's, none of which can be seen at a glance.

I am incarcerated, there will be obstacles and challenges to negotiate. "Never judge a book by it's cover,", I'm sure you've heard that before, and what would life be like for us if we were all to scared to explore?

I am spirited, there will be adventure and excitement to endure. And I am passionate, there is hope and a high regard for matters of the heart. But tomorrow I see change, a chance to build anew. Built on spirit, intent of heart and ideals based on truth. It's only a moment of your time, email me and you will be sent ways to contact me directly. 

Andre

title: Are you a fun, active couple?
text:
I'm posting this ad in the hopes of finding some new couples to spend time with, who aren't flaky and have the ability to commit to making plans ahead of time without always canceling at the last minute! I'm sure if you're taking the time to read this ad, you probably have friends like this - the kind who always complain about how they're bored and want to do stuff, but as soon as you propose doing something they're "busy" or "can't go." As you get older you realize you don't have the time or energy to constantly be the only side of the relationship putting in effort when it comes to spending time together. Therefore, if you are also a couple that wants to make new friends that are actually up for DOING things, let's talk! My husband and I live outside of Colorado Springs, but coming from the East Coast where it takes an hour to drive 15 miles on most days, driving doesn't bother either of us. Plus I figure that everyone here drives into the mountains throughout the year, so what's the difference in a one hour drive between the Springs and Denver suburbs if you have friends you want to spend time with?

One of the biggest reasons we moved to Colorado was to be able to enjoy the outdoors, so we want to meet other people who like to be outside and want to go hiking or visit new places on a semi-regular basis. We try to go hiking every weekend (though it's more low key now that it's colder), and I have a whole list of places I want to go in/around Colorado Springs and the rest of the state. Last summer we did a lot of hiking up off 70, climbed Quandary Peak and made our way out towards Aspen. We want to get down to the Sand Dunes and spend some time in Crested Butte this summer to see the wildflowers.

We have an awesome dog so if you like animals that's a plus. We adopted her over the summer and she loves trails, so she usually comes with us when we go hiking - unless of course it's somewhere dogs aren't allowed, we don't just bring her to be tools. Finding a couple with a dog that also wants to get out and explore would be great, but you don't have to have a dog as long as you don't hate them or something. 

My husband loves football, video/computer games (what dude doesn't?) and is in the process of getting his Masters degree. We both have hard science degrees, love to travel and do not smoke (anything). We don't have kids, and are looking for people in the same boat. 

If anything about this sounds familiar to you, feel free to shoot me an email so we can chat some more! I really hope there are some people out there who are in the same boat - there is too much cool stuff to do around here to sit inside and not get out and see it!

title: Really need a woman's advice
text:
So, I really need some perspective right now. My dating life has been strange lately. I don't do online dating, won't date girls from work and pretty much only hang out in my neighborhood. I also try not to mess around with girls in my neighborhood. I do meet girls, usually randoms that are I meet somewhere out in my neighborhood. That is usually either a straight hookup or very short term. 
Well, I met this girl last week at my regular bar recently. I had never seen her in there and she is one of those girls you would notice but she claims she goes in there and does live around there. We hit off but it was just great conversation. She showed up a few days later and actually told me she wanted to run into me and was surprised I didn't ask for her number last time. Again, it was a great time. She has a complicated life. She works and has a young child. So, from what she told me, she is very hesitant when it comes to guys. We made a plan for a proper date and have been texting daily ever since. 
So, this morning I responded to the last text she sent last night. I fell asleep early and it seemed like she was seeing if I was out or at home. I didn't get a response so just asked if she was having a busy day. She text back saying yes and it hasn't been a great day. I was consoling and said I wish I could meet her but I'm not off for a couple of hours. She said she had something to tell me. That's never good. She said she went out last night, to that neighborhood bar and ended up hooking up with someone. She feels horrible about it because that's not her and she really likes me. She just had a rough day at work and things went further than she wanted with drinking and that guy. She also said she understands if I don't want to talk to her anymore because I probably know the guy. 
So, I don't know what to think. I have my history. I was with someone for a random hookup the week before I met her but I think that situation is different. Considering we kissed, I'm imagining "hooking up" meant they had sex. She's been very clear about me having to be patient with her and I was willing. From our talks, I think she is finally over things with her ex and wanting to date someone. I liked the way she has been with me, really like her and we connect well. It's bad enough that her actions contradict what she has told me but even worse that I probably know the guy. I'm glad she was honest though. I guess that counts for something. 
So, please share some advice or thoughts with me. It's difficult because of how I mentioned my dating life is and I do honestly feel we had a great connection. Is there a way to get over this?

title: It's not really about the diet and exercise
text:
Having been involved in athletics and personal training for 30+ years,
I've achieved a lot of my personal targets around athletics and my body.
I've been stuck on the couch and shifted back into movement all the while thinking I don't have the time to exercise or eat right.

I've learned what really created the shifts for me to be able to achieve these targets I had for myself. It isn't the work or effort I put into it, it wasn't forcing discipline or faking that having patience was fine. It was a shift in how I was choosing to think. How I think about the target itself and how I think about the journey vs the end goal.

I can show you this, build a plan for you around your exercise, nutrition and the mindfulness habits to support and get you to your targets!

Would you be interested in a complimentary 30 minute discovery session to see what is possible for you, and if we can build this plan together to achieve your targets?

There is no obligation to hire me, and you will walk away with at least one tool you can employ right now to help you!

Reply to this post, and let's get you started today!

title: Searching for more ease with your life?

Do you have a desire to feel more at ease with life, no matter what is going on?

Having your Bars run can do just that. There are 32 points on your head that correspond to things like; healing, body, control, awareness, creativity, power, aging, sex and money. Each Bar corresponds with that aspect or area of your life that it is named.

They store the electromagnetic component of all the thoughts, ideas, attitudes, decisions and beliefs that you have ever had about anything.

For example; every thought you have ever had about money that you considered important, the energy of that thought is stored in the Bar called "money."

Touch one Bar and you begin to clear away the energy locked up in that area or aspect of your life just by touching it, clearing the space for new awareness to come in.

The creative possibilities for your life begin to open up!

It's been said that at worst a Bars session will feel like a great massage. At best, it will change your life!

title: Once long ago...
text:
I made a friend through Craigslist, and it was nerve wracking, perhaps embarrassing to think I'd needed to use the internet to find anyone to talk to. I've got a good personality, am fun, not a nut or a druggie and I even have all my teeth. But there I was, and he and I had made a connection, became friends and had big hopes for the future. 

But in time, he fell ill and passed away and I miss him terribly. I miss the random texts and his sense of humor. A lot has happened since then, and I find myself in a new town where everyone seems so very busy.

I'm not really expecting any replies and I don't expect to find what I had before (that wouldn't be fair to future friends), but I would like to move on. I'd love to have someone to text. 

That being said if you like heavy metal, odd things that are a little dark or macabre, art, film, the unusual, I'm for you. I'm open-minded, strange, and an artist. I love long conversations, but also cozy shared silence, falling asleep to a horror movie, going for walks in the rain in the summer, laying in the grass in a park in the middle of the night, laughs over pizza and playstation, people watching while sharing tea. I need a muse and a gentleman, but perhaps also an oddball, not someone who NEEDS me, but WANTS me. There's a difference. 

Anyway, friends or lovers, it doesn't matter. I'm happy with platonic, and believe that's where it should begin. **I'm not judgemental (I can handle most circumstance, I understand that shit happens), but please don't contact me if you're married. Be divorced, or working on a divorce for crap's sake. I'm no one's side woman. Pics will happen if we connect, and no, I don't want to see your dick.

title: Spun People's = Fun People's
text:
It takes all kinds of people to make the world go 'round. 
And we are a couple that chose to embrace those that 
are a little different, who's ideas of a good time venture 
outside the normal parameters set by society, and we are
seeking out those that are like us in this aspect.

Male, female, couples, it doesn't matter! Good people
are good people no matter what, and that's what we are 
looking for. Good, honest, down to earth people who 
still have morals and place value on being decent.

Dinner, movie night, drinks, game night,hot tub-ing, 
parties, day trips to try something new, or just sitting 
around smoking a bowl and hanging out. It doesn't 
have to be crazy, and it doesn't have to be super mellow.
As long as we have good people around us that's what 
matters, that's what makes or breaks the experiences.....

Weather you like the green to slow down and mellow out,
the clear to get spun and go fast, or the white to just 
go a little crazy for the night, we don't care, and we don't judge.
We believe that everything is good in moderation, everything 
can be used to enhance your experience and your life. 

Send us a message, tell us a little about yourself,
your interests and your dislikes, tell us about the things
that make you, well you. We will respond to you, and if it seems
that this could be a friendship that enhances all our lives, we 
can progress like we should. 

We are NOT looking for hook ups ( though we can always hook you
up with your favorite party favors) We are NOT looking for pnp 
(although we are not opposed to it either. We are of a "what happens
is what happens" mindset.) We truly are just looking to add some
more good people to our lives, and we can't wait to meet you!!!!

title: Searching for more ease with your life?
text:
Do you have a desire to feel more at ease with life, no matter what is going on?

Having your Bars run can do just that. There are 32 points on your head that correspond to things like; healing, body, control, awareness, creativity, power, aging, sex and money. Each Bar corresponds with that aspect or area of your life that it is named.

They store the electromagnetic component of all the thoughts, ideas, attitudes, decisions and beliefs that you have ever had about anything.

For example; every thought you have ever had about money that you considered important, the energy of that thought is stored in the Bar called "money."

Touch one Bar and you begin to clear away the energy locked up in that area or aspect of your life just by touching it, clearing the space for new awareness to come in.

The creative possibilities for your life begin to open up!

It's been said that at worst a Bars session will feel like a great massage. At best, it will change your life!

More questions? Check out this link:

http://access-consciousness-blog.com/2011/02/frequently-asked-questions-about-the-bars/

title: She tasted sweet, like oranges, liquid sunshine in my mouth...
text:
Why do I want to meet you?

I want to meet because making that new connection is so intense and exciting and yes even awkward but still delicious. 

I want to meet because when our gazes meet I feel a ferocious rush of possibility. For me to try and deny my attraction and seem unaffected is pointless. My cells all scream. I am reeling. And I want to show you how I feel.

I want to meet because another soul has never had your particular eyes, your shade of skin, tone of voice, your unique scent. No one has ever had your energy and no one ever will and I want to drink it up. 

I want to meet because life is short and I don't want to leave this place someday regretting that I did not reach out to you. I don't want to wonder 'What if I had just been honest about how I feel? Would we have done our dance? Left our mark? Would we have added our play and our joy to the mix?'

I want to meet because there are hidden parts to me. One so tender that wants to show tenderness. One so primal and untamed it wants to make that known to you as well. One so sensual that wants to a awaken your senses. One that thirsts and wants to be intoxicated by your scents and your sounds and your tastes.

I want to meet because I'll admit it: a part of me craves the power to have you in the palm of my hand...quivering, shivering, aching, sweating, longing for bliss, spasming and begging for release. And I would like to grant it.

I want to meet because I'm tired of seeing you without speaking out, without reaching out, without touching, without embracing, without feeling your warmth for a time.

I want to meet even though yes I already have a life and do not want to walk away and destroy it. Still though, life is complicated and this fire inside of me to feel passion and romance won't burn out. The curiosity inside for the unfamiliar and the exotic won't be denied.

title: a friendship
text:
I moved to the Denver area a few months ago and have spent much of that time alone, which isn't good for me, but I find it tiring to introduce myself to people over and over again only to find that they bore me. But don't despair--if you're reading this, you're probably not boring, even if you think you are. Anywho, that brings me here, again, in search of a friend. 

I am looking for a friendship of some sort, whether it's through texting or email or an occasional real-life meet for coffee or walk somewhere or anything, really. I can be difficult to get to know, and difficult to have as a friend, but may-haps I'm worth it. I'm not looking for a relationship outside of the bounds of a friend.

I would say I like deep conversations, but I'm not sure how deep. I like to walk without a destination in mind, often to look at houses. I like to sit on park benches and stare at trees while absorbing the sunlight. I recently took up painting. If I'm particularly bored, I like to knit scarves. I like to read, though I'm not as voracious as I once was. I like to cook and bake, and I sometimes like to vacuum, but only because I don't have much furniture. 

So if this interests you, I await your reply.

title: Please save me from myself
text:
I'm stuck in my head.

Hello there, I'm a 26 year old female who is going through a 1/4 life crisis. I'm so confused and lost. My life is on autopilot. 

I've lost motivation to change myself and eventually I'll probably just accept the failure that I am. 

I'm 225 lbs. I gained the weight back I worked so hard to lose. Despite having a gym membership and funds for healthy food, I lack the drive to make changes. 

I compare myself to others and come up inadequate. 

I have nothing to show for myself. 

I feel guilty for 98% of every action I do. Slept through my alarm? Yep, I'm a failure. Didn't stick to my diet? I should give up. I find myself lusting after someone? That's gross and shameful. 

If I could sleep all day, I would. I'm not living. 

How do I become the person I want to be? The size, shape, persona, of my dream self? I lack the determination of change, though I desire it so much. 

If I keep going this route, I'm going to hate myself even more.

Please help

title: Friends with Benefits (but, please read definition of "benefits")
text:
Craigslist is loaded with postings from lonely people, and there are many (especially guys) who are looking for a FWB situation. This generally means that they are looking for casual sex, no commitments. It is pretty shallow and superficial. Unfortunately, it also is a good indicator of how sad things have become: people in unsatisfying relationships, who have found that being with ONE PERSON does not meet all their needs.

I am also in one of those relationships. These things get complicated, and there are numerous reasons not to end it. In my case, children, a genuine caring and love (you can love someone but not BE IN LOVE), certain needs and dependencies your mate may have, and even practical things like financial. This is not a case of verbal or physical abuse, massive infidelity, or general incompatibility. Sometimes you fall out of love, and over many years lose all the spark... you function almost simply as room mates.

So, what are the benefits I am looking for?? In this case, having an emotional connection. Having an attraction where you feel appreciated, noticed, valued; being able to share intimate things, someone with whom a deep friendship can develop. Sometimes, there is a physical chemistry as well, and even the excitement of that feeling is worth a great deal, even if you agree not to pursue it. Not sure if I can go there, but maybe. 

Having these feelings, and the specialness of a close friend, with whom you can share most anything... maybe even finding a touch of that soul mate that you lack.

So this is what I seek. 

A bit about me: I turn 58 soon, retired, fit and decent looking; high energy, creative, witty, intelligent and well-educated, a voracious reader, good writer, musical, good cook and a foodie. I like to talk over strong coffee or a glass of wine. I like long walks on a warm, calm day (does the wind EVERY stop here?). I want us to be mutually interested in each other, our gifts, our life stories... and have similar needs: we both are in relationships but want more. Obviously, discretion is a must.

title: Looking for a down to earth girl
text:
Hello everyone. I'm just going to tell you a story. I was on a road trip and riding in the passenger seat of my brother's car when a semi truck ran right into the passenger side going about 40 mile per hour. I don't remember the accident at all. They had to cut me out of the car with the jaws of life. I just remember waking up and the doctors telling me that they can't treat me at the hospital and they can either transport me to Wichita or Denver. Since I'm from Colorado and my family lives in the Springs I of course chose Denver. 
My femur was broken in two places and I had fractured my pelvis in multiple locations and I had an ureatheral tear. (which is the scariest injury to me!) They put a metal rod in my leg that night. I have to relearn how to walk all over again, but I know that through hard work, determination and faith I will heal up in the next six to eight weeks.
And that is why I am posting this. My family can only visit once a week, if that, and I normally can handle being alone but I find myself getting kind of lonely in this hospital room. I'm looking for a smart woman who can hold a good conversation to come and visit me during the day. 
I am a 29 year old white male with a full beard. I like the outdoors, camping, riding my mountain bike. I love to travel! In fact, I'm going to start working on my dream of being able to travel and make a living at the same time. After this accident I'm going to start living my dream! 
So if you are interested in meeting a nice guy who stands up for his convictions in a non-threatening environment like a hospital room, than email me and maybe we can eat lunch together. You don't need to buy me lunch I'm not a bum, I'll order both of us some good ole hospital food from room service, lol. I'm a smart ass so if you don't like sarcasm you wouldn't like conversations with me. After a couple of emails I'll tell you what hospital I'm at and the room number. I would also like to talk to you first as well,

title: Looking for that special guy!
text:
Hello; Was just looking with no expectations, really...But, hey...no gain, no pain. Right? lol

Looking to meet single or divorced male ONLY. Pls no married or attached, or separated. Not interested. Looking for someone who is young at heart, with no baggage, or hang ups. 

Ideally, I am attracted to Caucasian men, a bit younger, hard working, and proud, with intelligence and wits.

The very reason for this ad is to find a clean cut type guy with old fashioned values and standards. May be north west has it? Here on the east coast, or N.E. we have none. Nobody to date. I gave up.

I am in central MA, two hours from Boston. I am divorced, professional, young at heart and looks female. I am in my fifties, but not shabby at all...much younger guys ask me out, if you can believe it.
I have pictures to prove it...lol

But, later, please! No pressure. And, I wont pressure you. I can assure you, I am real, I am sane, a I am clean cut, down to earth, low maintenance woman. But, I am also independent, and free spirited.

Can be feisty and direct. I don't shy a way from confrontations or a debate. Not needy at all.

Ideally, I want to find that special guy for friendship and communication first. If we click, and connect, and all goes well...I don't mind to visit. Distance should not be an issue. Agree?

I enjoy nature, hiking, gardening, walks, culture, music, travel, reading, and much more...

So, there...didn't want to make it long...but, don't want to waste my time or yours either.

I guess, I am looking for someone who is on the same wave length.

Anyhow...that's it from me. Be looking forward to hearing from you!

One thing I hate when I receive one line emails with no substance at all. 

I delete. End of story.

Otherwise, be happy to hear from you!

Thanks.

title: burned great guy looking for friend
text: I don't know what to say, or even why I am here, or what I am looking for. I met the girl of my dreams 14 years ago. I married her after meeting only a few times, I was young and dumb and in love... adopted her 8 month old baby and took him on as my own with no hesitancy. I spent 14 years making sure she knew she was the love of my life. I opened doors, courted her, made her breakfast every morning, found different ways to show my love, flowers randomly every month, etc. etc. etc. We had our ups and downs, and both had our bad habbits but I thought we were happy overall. She said she was. Until one day she left her computer open and I caught a message.... she was about to meet up to screw some other guy she barely knew.....yeah so my world was flipped upside down. I spent years making her feel loved (always felt un appreciated by her) and here some guy was able to almost just walk right in ( she claims nothing happened) i'll never know. so I don't know where I am now. I have 3 kids, I can't turn their life upside down. No one knows that she did this, they all think shes so perfect (I am not about to destroy her reputation with anyone including our kids) but I just don't see the point of trying, and going out of my way to make her feel special. this guy was engaged (nice guys always finish last apparently) so I guess im looking for someone to talk to who can relate or likes to be treated like the center of someone's world once in a while. if you are still reading hit me up. I am 35, have a great career I love camping, shooting, hiking, working out and just about everything.

title: Verge of Surrender
text:
I can only speak for myself, but I assume I am not alone. 

Women complain that there are no decent guys; that all men want are FWBs or one-nighters, or when a request for a pic is sent, a shot of a man's weiner comes back.

I am an older guy, 50, but still look youngish. All my dark hair, all my teeth, 5'11", a hint of my young Army officer body remains. 

I met a woman online last week, she said she was European and wanted a nice relationship. I emailed. She thanked me for my mature response. We chatted that first night and she asked if we could meet right away. I couldn't, but figured she was spontaneous.

I made a date for the next Sunday night but had a major project come up and had to postpone. She lives downtown, I said I had an appt downtown Tuesday and maybe we could meet then.

Tuesday noon, I text her and offer to meet her for a light lunch and maybe a glass of wine. On me. Her response:

"What an inconsiderate asshole you are! I just woke up."

Just woke up? What are you, a dopesmoking teen?

I was taken aback, tried to calm her down, then out of left field, she texts; "All you Colorado men just want sex, you want to try to fuck me!"

I had a NO TIME made any reference to sex, hooking up, or anything but decent chatting. 

I was very disappointed as I was looking to meet someone for movies, cooking, driving into the mountains, general fun and companionship. One need not discuss sex, if you like each other the sex will happen naturally. 

When I spontaneously meet women, they like me. But I can never wrangle those meets into a date. 

Honestly, I'm beginning to think all women are nuts.

title: Nerd4Nerd
text:
My boyfriend and I just moved here from Florida. I love it here so far, but I know about two people outside of work. All we need now are some like minded individuals to geek out together. 

STOP NOW if you are looking for anything other than friendship. I do not want naughty photos. Not looking for a hookup or anything of the kind. If you are planning on emailing me asking for 'noods' please just forget this post or I exist. Ok now that that is covered back to the actual post lol

We have pets so would prefer if you weren't allergic as we are always covered in pet hair of all kinds.

We are BIG time gamers. I collect consoles, but my boyfriend is a PC gamer. Also love us some boardgames! Would be great to meet someone who loves boardgames, so we could set up game nights. We do not play your typical boardgames though. No monopoly! Warning: he is a sore winner/loser. Don't play with us if you can't handle A LOT of shit talking and competition.

I am a crafter. Mainly I cross stitch for my Etsy shop. I am learning to knit and crochet. I sew, but it is mostly liners for my chinchilla cage lol. I want to try more hobbies, and have a shopping buddy for the craft shop. Be prepared to spend hours in there if we go. 

I bake! Food is a passion. I love to bake and cook. I eat meat, but I don't care if you don't. 

As for reading, films, and such. I love scifi! I read mainly science fiction. I watch The Walking Dead, Game of Thrones, Girls, Once Upon a Time, Bojack Horseman, The 100, Orange is the New Black, etc. I love Battlestar Galactica and Firefly. I will watch almost any movie or show except I HATE ALL THINGS TWILIGHT AND FIFTY SHADES. Favourite movies: Star Wars, Stardust, Hitchhiker's Guide. I love anime! And I am Studio Ghibli obsessed! 

Please never use the words: Bae, Turnt, Thot, or Fleek. They are not real words. I don't mind if your spelling sucks or even grammar. Use all the short hand typing your want or we can have a conversation in emojis lol just not those words.

I work part time so I have A LOT of free time.

I curse like a sailor. If swearing bothers you I can try to watch my language, but you have been warned. My favourite word is the 'F word' which I say countless times throughout the day. 

I have a few disorders I try not to let get in the way of my day. If you were understanding when I have 'bad days' or 'episodes' that would be super! I have anxiety, depression, OCD, and mild agoraphobia.

My boyfriend and I are crazy immature. So, we would prefer friends in the 21-30 age bracket. Unless you are also immature then 'age ain't nothing but a number.' We do not have kids. I do not mind kids they just aren't for me. I lack the maternal instinct (no it will not come with time and I will not change my mind so please don't say this to me). I am crazy awkward around children. So, if you have kids I don't mind just don't be offended when I get weird around them because I really have no idea how to act. 

I do not care what your sexual orientation, skin colour, religion, or political stand is (unless you're a trump supporter. If you are again forget I exist). But if that stuff matters to you here are my stances on them: I am bi, white, agnostic (raised baptist), independent (Sanders supporter), pro-choice, etc. 


So, now that I have written a novel haha if you think we could be friends send me a message.

title: Hi from Seattle! Seeking cool email friends, maybe more.
text:
Maybe you've thought about moving to the PNW, or maybe you're just bored and want a new friend to exchange emails with. Whatever the case may be, I'm available for email or chat.

Due to my working a night shift, I pretty much have to resort to trying to meet people online. I have tried to post locally and haven't had very much luck. My theory is that due to living in such an "IT guy" concentrated region, there is huge competition when it comes to meeting women online. Or maybe I'm just not doing it right? Who knows. I've tried OkCupid and that seems even worse.

A little about me...

Being that I live in Seattle, you may have me somewhat figured out. I smoke weed, I drink coffee, I work in technology, and I'm progressive. I have LGBT friends and family. So, we may not mesh well if you're religious or conservative, though I'm open for debating stuff if that's your thing.

I work in IT for a popular retail company. As I mentioned, I work a night shift which leaves me fairly isolated, however I only work 3-4 nights a week, so that's nice because it allows me time to work on music and do other productive things like play video games and watch movies. I like working nights, being awake at night. It's peaceful and sort of like a whole different world. I do stay up until around noon, so it's not like I don't get to see daylight ever, but this schedule does not seem conducive to making new friends.

I play and record guitar, bass, synths, drums, and vocals. I don't have a band right now, but I'm hoping to put one together soon, and I'm hoping that playing my music live will help with meeting people. My music is sort of indie rock with some electronica. My musical tastes range from jazz like Ella Fitzgerald and Miles Davis, to bands like Tool and Radiohead. I was raised on The Beatles, Paul Simon, Billy Joel, Abba, classic rock. One of my favorite 'contemporary' bands is Pinback.

I like getting out and about when I can. There are so many great, beautiful places around Seattle to explore, hike, go camping, etc. I also enjoy traveling when I get the chance. I have been to Canada and Scotland and I'd like to visit many more places, take your pick.

I'm getting back into shape and I feel pretty good about it. I have a home gym where I work out about every other day. I'm also eating healthier; lots of vegetables and fewer carbs/sugar. I'm growing my own garden this year, too, so I'm excited about that.

So, yeah, that's a little about me, now how about you? Feel free to ask me anything, too. I look forward to hearing from you (Ê˜â€¿Ê˜)

title: Agoraphobia
text:
Hi. My name is Kalia, I'm 23, and I have agoraphobia.

What that means, practically, is that I have a hard time leaving my home. It makes it pretty difficult to meet people, as you can probably guess.

Commonly asked questions: No, I don't work. Yes, I get my groceries delivered. No, staying at home is not "relaxing and fun". Yes, it's very lonely. No, I didn't make a decision to live this way, I have a condition that requires it. Yes, I'm working very hard towards my recovery.

I'm looking for a friend. Someone who will like me and spend time with me in spite of my limitations. I have trouble leaving my home, but otherwise I'm a normal person. I like action movies and comedy specials. I'm a huge nerd. I love comic books and superheroes, as well as magic and fantasy. I play a lot of video games, especially RPGs like Skyrim and Fallout. I read fanfiction. I'm into Game of Thrones and Harry Potter, Arrow and The Flash. My favorite cartoon is Steven Universe.

I want to meet someone who will bring over blankets and pillows for a movie marathon, or help me try a new recipe for the first time, or go for long walks around the neighborhood.

I have a lot of free time on my hands, and I'd like to spend some of it with a new friend.

Please put your favorite color in the subject line!

title: Outdoor Activity Partner
text:
Hi,

I am seeking someone fun who likes to be outdoors and participate in outdoor activities. This is platonic. Can include lunch or breakfast before or after or beers. I am just a busy guy who is wanting someone fun to do outdoor activities with and make friends with.

You should like to do one or all of the following activities. I am in very good physical shape and like to push myself and keep active and fit.

-Road cycling (more paved trails than roads)
-Mtn biking (light to moderate intensity)
-Running and jogging on paved trails, open space trails and at Wash Park
-Indoor spinning and fitness
-Racquetball
-Hiking
-Skiing
-Working out a Red Rocks

I'd prefer someone in their late 20's or 30's, or early 40's just so we might have something in common. I like people who are on time when we agree to go do something and have a good attitude about the activity.

Please send some basic info if you reply and what you like to do outside for fun.

Thanks

title: Best friend wanted
text:
I am looking for a best friend. A guy or a girl, doesn't matter to me. The only thing that matters is that you have a good heart, be non judgmental, be tolerant of others (have no hate for color or orientation), have a love of animals. I don't eat anything from animals and try to keep a cruelty free, green home. Someone with a similar frame of mind would be great. I am kind of an introvert and ISTP/INTJ on the MB personality type, which makes it a little hard to be outgoing to find friends. I am better texting but I'm not into all the abbreviations. I know lol and brb but that's about all I care to know or use. I just want to have a friend that has my back, and will know what to say to make me laugh or calm me down. I don't have kids and don't want any. If you have kids that's cool, its just not my thing. Please feel free to ask questions to get to know me. 

A little survey about me:
Age: 36 years
Gender: Female
Relationship Status: Single
How Long Have You Lived In The Area?: 2-5 years
I'm Looking To Meet: A few good friends
Activities/Interests: yoga, cooking, people watching, crafty things (things you make), photography, animal lover/pet owner, crime/mystery reader, movies, dog walking/dog park, fitness/exercise
Education Level: Some College/Technical School
How Often Do You Smoke?: Never
How Often Do You Drink Alcohol?: Rarely
Languages Spoken Other than English: sarcasm, bad english, movie/tv quotes, whale
Pets?: Dog, Cat
Most Of My Friends Tend To Be: Don't Know/Don't Care
How Do you React If Plans Get Cancelled?: I'm generally understanding, but I can only be blown off so many times before I will start to question the friendship.
How Do You Spend Your Days: Sleeping. I work nights. My nights off- I run errands, clean, play with my dog, watch movies, surf Pinterest, read, crochet.... normal stuff
Favorite Movies: Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy.
Favorite Music: Rock- Rob Zombie
Favorite TV Shows: Buffy the Vampire Slayer- All time Grey's Anatomy- On air
Favorite Books: Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy Stephen King Jeff Lindsay Dean Koontz Christopher Rice and him mom Anne The Monk series Christopher Morre Chuck Palahniuk David Sedaris The list goes on and on...
My Friends And I Usually Talk About: Work, Family, Other
A Good Friend Is Someone Who...: is always there for me., always sides with me no matter what., will be honest with me even if it hurts., gives advice., takes my advice., is an activity partner.
Anything else you want to say?: I'm looking for a best friend. "My Person" Someone who accepts all the dark and twisty. Who I can have inside jokes with, speak endlessly with movie/tv quotes. Someone who will make me be better and I them. A team like: Tina Fey and Amy Poehler Will and Grace Meridith and Christina Jen Aniston and Courtney Cox J.D. and Turk If you don't know who any of these people are: "You can't sit with us!"

Hey everyone! 

I am an attached female, living with my partner and our two pups. He is very into gaming, board games and video games, and I am very into art of all forms. We share a love for Doctor Who, Adventure Time, A Perfect Circle and music like it, Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, and weird hats. We are both individually very quirky (Gemini and Aquarian). He is completely sober and always has been, so while I don't drink or smoke around him, I do drink and smoke (420) on occasion. It is important for him to not have those substances used around him. I am 22, and he is 30. 

When I bought my 3 day passes for Comic Con in June, I realized that we are at a point where we don't have any friends close enough to go to con with, or to share a hotel room or anything like that, as we did last year. So, I'm reaching out, looking for some great people to get to know, who might be interested in going to DCC with us and getting to know us. We both really crave having good friends in our lives. 

Shoot me an email and tell me some of your interests, if you've ever been to DCC, and what you might be looking for in a friend.

title: Straight male seeking friend(s) - Hopefully true, close ones at that.
text:
Let me start this off by saying this; If you are easily offended, super emotional and such - DO NOT BOTHER REPLYING. I go out of my way to make that obvious, as I don't want to have you or I waste our time. Another item, I've just recently rescued an unhealthy, 5 week old border collie puppy - So I'm a bit tied to my home or items we could bring him to. If that's not something you'd be up for, also don't reply. Next, I want to mention that I am straight and in a relationship at this time - Though I could care less if you're gay, straight, bi, or what not. Now let's get to the general parts of this posting! 

About Me: 25, male, white, blond, blue eyes, et cetera. I drink on occasion, do edibles (cannabis) occasionally as well but nothing harder - Please don't do anything harder and don't be a heavy smoker (cigarettes, can't stand the smell personally). 

My Hobbies: I'm a Systems Engineer/Administrator, so technology on the whole is my passion and career. I also do enjoy gaming, mainly FPS, racing or sports games. Sports wise, I'll watch just about anything but I am particularly into NBA. I'm also trying to get a little more active, such as making more trips up to the mountains to go hiking and going out to play basketball/sports. Plus getting out to dog parks (when the puppy is old enough and in better health) and other dog friendly events/items.

What I'm searching for and why: I don't believe in having a lot of 'friends' who I barely know and barely know me. I'd rather have a 'best friend' or a couple of really close friends. Due to moving a lot growing up and just moving out here soon, I don't really have any out here. I've stopped being in denial, as my 'best friend' was always making me pick up the tab and would flake out on hanging out at last minute (without even letting me know, just silence). I'm not saying I want to not pick up tabs or anything like it, I just don't want to get stuck in a friendship that's 1 sided and not a true friendship.

Well, hopefully after I laid all this out there - There's some of you who read this that will reply and we'll hit it off. If not, then I hope you find whatever it is you're on here looking for.

title: Meeting new and intresting people
text:
Ok never tried this before so here it goes.

I'm Mike, a fun laid back chill guy to be around. Just recently moved back to Denver and looking to meet make new friends. I get along with everyone so really doesn't matter who you are I'm sure will click.

My hobbies consist of going to the movies, out with friends, playing pool/ bowling. I love taking random strolls around town. Traveling and exploring. Trying new restaurants and places. I'm pretty much up for trying anything at least once (NOT DRUGS THOUGH!!!) and yes that includes 420.

Ok, now that's out of the way. You can often see me at car shows, walking around the mall, downtown or pretty much checking out some place I recently heard about. I'm always keeping an ear out for upcoming events. Summer is my favorite time of the year just love the outdoors, but I do enjoy the winter to point. Sorry not a huge fan of the cold...which is funny because I'm a born and raised native here in Colorado.

Here little bit more. . ..

Books: MAGS (Car, Computer, Comic, Geek, Music, etc..) History Books, LOTR, The Hobbit, Mystery Thrillers, pretty much anything really.

Movies: Comedy, Action, Disney/Pixar, Historical.

Music: Mostly Alternative Rock, EDM, Trance, and a little Rap/R&B. (I HATE HEAVY METAL!!!!)

Shows: F1 Racing, Top Gear (BBC), Game of Throwns, Person of Interest, Pawn Stars.

Movies: I LOVE MOVIES. I love cuddling up at home and watching a movies, love going to the theaters to.

Foods: Sea foods, Italian, Asian Cuisines, Indian, My own cooking!!!!. I love trying new restaurants.

P.S. Don't ask me who my favorite artist/bands, actors/actress are. I really don't make it a point to remember there names. Just the names of songs and movies.

title: If you had a male best friend who truly got you...
text:
What if? What if you had a really down to earth guy in your world who legitimately took time to hear you when he listened to you? One who didn't try to solve your problems, but who took time to cherish the way you work through them? He was honorable to your needs without being a burden. He got you stoned and played you a band you never heard before?

And what if, when this cool ass dude recognized how hot you were, let you watch him fantasize about how awesome you are while you watched?

Never any "crossing-of-the-lines". Totally platonic, just with a rebellious disdain for whatever the difference is between rubbing my shoulder or my throbbing cock in front of you. One is definitely more interesting to watch, you can't deny that!

I'm interested to hear from any woman who looks good in a dress.

title: Really need a woman's perspective
text:
I need someone to help explain to me what happened. I wish I ask this of friends but most would find me thinking about this so much absurd. I'm sure I'll be over it in week but right not it's staying in my mind. I met this girl this past Friday. It was out at a bar but under unique circumstances. I was with a friend, we all got to talking and having some drinks and ended up at my place. I don't recall this but she told me later that my buddy finally got a clue that her and I were into each other and left. We ended up going to her place because she has a dog and had a great night and morning. Normal things would have ended at that but she had the 3 day weekend off and so did I. I ended up staying until late Monday morning and the only reason I left was because she got called into work. It was a whirlwind and very strange but in a good way. For me it felt like we condensed weeks, if not more, of dating into 3 days. I know it wasn't the same as dating but it was in how much we opened up and shared with each other it felt that way. Although we didn't make specific plans, we talked about how having her dog overnight at my place was okay and she mentioned I should visit her at work. She nannies so its and fairly casual environment. Also, in two separate conversations we both invited each on trips we were planning. It was that kind of vibe. I want to say that I'm not inexperienced either. I'm not desperate or lonely. She doesn't seem any of those things either. This was truly a strange and once in a lifetime experience.So, I think it's pretty reasonable that I thought we would be in contact and even start seeing each other. Well, it doesn't feel like that's happening. 
Since, Monday it's been virtually radio silence on her end. I haven't been bombarding her with texts nor have I said anything too serious or even asked when I would see her next. She responded some on Monday night but yesterday, I sent a couple and nothing. Today I sent one and nothing. She did say on Monday that something was happening at work and she may need to stay a few nights there. She also said she'll typically work 12-16 days. I have no reason to doubt that and when I was with her she wasn't all over her phone but did seem to respond to most messages. She obviously wasn't working then either. I just think two days without a response is making a statement. So, do you think wrong with that? 
Assuming I'm right and she's blowing me off, I'm left wondering why. Was it just a weekend fling? Maybe we got so close, so fast that it scared her off. One factor may also be her ex. She mentioned him a few times. My assessment on that is that she still feels a connection. She hasn't gotten as close to a guy since and she feels this bond over some of the things they went through. 
The reason this bothers me is because I like her. She is beautiful, fun and we had great chemistry both physically and personality wise. I don't come across that too often. I know I'm very self-protective. If I don't hear from her soon, any feeling I have will shut off. I think that's a shame but it's the way I work. I feel kind bad right now. 
So, as a woman, let me know your take on things. 

______________________________________________________________

title: Just looking for friends, true friends.
text:
"You're a fun-loving, goofy, nerdy, sometimes annoying, extremely loving, too kind for your own good, moron of a genius." I was having trouble describing myself with out bias, so I asked my niece to describe me, and the above was her reply... Cue the 'Captain Obvious' line. I often speak without thinking first, I'm not great with diction or being vocal, and I'm possibly a bit insane, but who isn't? Insane, I mean. If you stop for a moment, and look at our world and humanity as a whole, without allowing any bias or delusions to cloud your judgement, it's clear that everyone is (and I believe this is the clinical term) absolutely batshit crazy. (Cue the 'Holy run-on sentence, Batman!')
For the most part, it's not the creative, positively constructive,'forever change the world and/or the way people see it and/or each other' way. Mostly, it's the kind of insanity that manages to pass as sane to most people, simply because it's how most people are.. I personally think that sanity is overrated, but then again, my insanity is why I'm determined to change the world. Life is an amazing, wondrous, beautiful, captivating, and still indescribable thing that so many people take for granted. They spend their lives hounding over material things that they use to define who they are, or they live with the goal of dying, believing (or maybe just desperately hoping?) that a book written (and rewritten several thousand times, and copied from even older, yet similar books) by uneducated, ignorant men who were trying to comprehend, and explain, this mindblowing thing we call 'life', is something that everyone needs to believe in and if they don't, then those nonbelievers will be punished in some way after their death, for the rest of eternity. Meanwhile, most of those people don't understand their own beliefs, or the texts that their beliefs are based on. If people want to believe those books, all the power to them, so long as they don't try to shove it down other people's throats, don't repress other people's beliefs, and ESPECIALLY don't try to use their books to take away the rights of other people. To some, what I've written thus far will translate to: "I hate religion, religious people are all horrid and evil, I am a worshipper of Satan, etc etc," but I honestly don't care what your religious beliefs are or aren't. If it inspires you to be a better person, to help others in need and makes you feel happy about yourself, then that's what matters. So long as you aren't being a dick about it (for lack of an equally simplistic phrasing), then I'm not going to care. I'm very open minded, though in the words of Bill Nye, evidence would change my mind, but for now I'm fairly certain in the knowledge I currently possess. 
On a more personal note, I'm definitely a nerd by every definition. I love science, math, history, video games, comic books (I absolutely love debating characters, and there's very little I don't know concerning the DC and Marvel Universes), and pretty much everything from Nintendo. Pokemon is definitely an 'obsession', though I use the term loosely, as well as Star Wars, Lord of the Rings, pretty much anything SciFi or of the supernatural nature. My dream is to be an architect, to build my own successful business, and create something that people will look at with awe after I die. I plan to create a unique hotel chain that celebrates humanity and both our diversity and unity, and donate 30% of the profits from every hotel to a multitude of charities and foundations I plan to set up, to help those who need it, to give people a second chance or just a chance that they never would have had, and set in motion a wave of change that I hope will spread across the world. Being good isn't always easy, and that's why heroes are hailed as heroes; they set an example as something so drastically different than what's normal.. But all they did, was do the right thing. What does that say about the world? 
I've been here since September 30th, and I still haven't met anyone. Really need some friends. 
If you're interested, you can email me, Kik me (HailTesla), Snapchat (TrainerNerdcore), or text me (seven twenty- nine ninety-eight - thirty-one fifty-three). I don't care which, honestly, but text or Kik will probably get the fastest response.

title: Single Mamas Lonely Hearts Club
text:
Ok so maybe you're not technically a "single" mama, maybe you are happily coupled with an amazing partner. Yet somehow you end up feeling very alone the majority of days. It's your first time on this amazing trip called parenthood yet somehow it's not exactly what you expected. A little more isolated, a little more monotonous. You feel guilty for even thinking this way. Shouldn't you be positive? I mean, most of the mamas in the world would kill to have the basic freedoms and privileges that you take for granted. But no matter. You look around and see so many mamas and babies but so few connections are made. Sometimes as I walk around Wash Park with my LO I see other solitary mamas and I want to say, "hello over there! How is it going? Are you lonely too?" But of course I don't. It would be odd. 
Let's walk this path together and collect others along the way who feel like they are somehow doing this wrong even while making all the right decisions. No mama needs to be lonely. We should support each other. 
Let's get together and enjoy this special time of our lives.

title: I'M FEELING BLUE ...oh so b l u e
text:
It's such a nice day out there.
And I'm stuck inside all day.
Gawd . . .
And I gots the blues. Yeah. I'm blue. So blue . . . .

Now while I don't have any recent pictures of myself, here's a copy of me when I was a baby.
I know. I know. I was REALLY big for my age. 
And I remember when this picture was taken. I didn't want to go to this artsy farsty place, to begin with. But you know when you're just a kid, you really don't have much of a say in the matter. So they took me to this "happening" and set me on the floor (as you can see in the picture above), and went to look at those stoopid pictures. There I was. Sitting in the middle of the floor, with nothing to do. I was depressed. yeah. feeling blue . . . real blue...so very blue.
And by the way, did you happen to notice how my toes were sorta curling up tight-like? Ya see - while I was feeling blue, I was also pissed off. And there's only 2 things that make my toes curl up like that. When I'm pissed off, and when I'm in the final throes of some hot sex.

AND IT DOESN'T LOOK LIKE I'M HAVING SOME HOT SEX NOW, DOES IT ?!??!??!?!?

title: Love (noun)
text:
Love is defined as a profoundly tender, passionate affection for another person. 
Love is a feeling of warm, personal attachment or deep affection. 
Love is an affectionate concern for the well-being of another person. 
For decades, people have theorized that love conquers all. That love is all you need. 
People have dreamed about it, searched for it, sacrificed for it. 
Love is the theme of almost all movies, novels, songs and poetry.
Love can be given or received. It can be seen and felt. 
But love is one of few concepts that can be modified. 
Most things are set it stone. Most things are defined, clearly, so that people can understand. 
But not love. 
Love is arguably the most complex idea known to man. 
Yet, people believe that they know so much about it. 
They admit they've felt it, found it, lost it, had it, been in it.
But it's only those who can hold onto it that truly understand its definition.

text:
Hello, my name is Carlos, there's nothing I like doing more than playing video games, watching decent movies / tv series and hitting the gym. At times it feels like watching a good movie or being in a competitive and challenging game online is better than sex. I wish to find someone who can relate.

I normally workout alone at Athmar Rec center but lately I've been meaning to find someone who can push and motivate me in the weight room and vice versa. I don't need a trainer and I don't wish to train anyone seeing as most newbies tend to quit in less than two months.

I'd prefer to workout with someone on my level but it's not a deal breaker. My dead lift max is set at 400 pounds, my squat is 350 x2 reps and my bench is 100 pound dumbells x3 reps.

I'm a vegan, I don't drink, smoke nor do drugs. I'm always calm I never raise my voice nor lose my temper, I dislike loud noises and loud people so I tend to go out of my way to avoid sport fans. I'm an atheist and I'm introverted by nature so I prefer to spend time with only one person at a time and I'm a total homebody on weekdays, on Weekends I love going out some where random (museum, restaurants, downtown). 

Please be under 25 years of age, it's cool if your're gay or bi but the odds of us doing anything sexual are very slim. Please reply with your favorite movie or video game in the subject line so I know you bothered to read the article prior to replying. 

If the add is still up I'm still looking. I will reply to every email with in the same day.

title: Friendships of the uncommon kind
text:
Hi,

Thanks for taking the time to read my post. For some time now, it's been clear my circle of friends has grown smaller, and those I do have are shifting. I am feeling less connected than many years ago when we began our friendship. Though they are dear to me, I am finding myself longing for a connection with another who values not only intellect, attending to physical body's needs (e.g. exercise, sustenance) but also has a desire to be better than he is today. I am seeking someone who finds gratitude in the smallest of things (e.g. the sunshine, the water, the contributions others have made to his life) and wants to share in that kindling of a new friendship to create new opportunities of gratitude and sharing

A little bit more about me: Single, blk, gay (though you do not have to be), 41. I like intimate coffee talks and smaller venues to get to know others, non-drug user, non-smoker to include 420, rarely drink. I also enjoy reading specifically books on dreams, hiking, exercise, good company, good movies. I find that for me it's not about the activities but the people I share those activities with that determine if I am having a good time.

Who I would like to meet: people with life experiences that have strengthened them but have also provided them with humility, those who know there is more to life than just the daily grind, those looking to connect with quality individuals and have their lives bettered for knowing another human in the world, those who have a great sense of humor but is also kind in their humor, and those who can challenge me to being a better person as I will challenge them out of my commitment to support others in being the best they can.

If interested, please say hello. Until our paths cross, I wish you all the best life has to offer.

title: Bike & Hike & Drive
text:
I enjoy riding and walking around lakes and streams.
I usually bike on bicycle trails in the Denver metro area riding between 15 and 30 miles. I ride slowly. My average speed is between 10 and 12 miles an hour. I have ridden around the Aurora Reservoir, Chatfield Dam, Standley Lake, Barr Lake, Cherry Creek Dam, Sloan's Lake, Bear Creek Lake, up and down the Platte River to Confluence Park, the Cherry Creek Trail, the Clear Creek Trail, and the Highline Canal path. 
I walk in open spaces in Jefferson County, Boulder County , and Douglas County. I hike between 2 and 15 miles. I have been thinking about walking up Mt. Bierstadt and walking into Lake Abyss this summer.
I drive all over Colorado mostly day trips and an occasional overnight trip. I mostly drive in the mountains and not so much on the eastern plains although I have done both. I have driven over 23 mountain passes in the past two years. I still have some more to drive over. Occasionally I do some four wheel driving.
If these are things you would enjoy doing, please get in touch. One thing that may make me difficult to get along with is that I am very impulsive and impromptu. I will sit down at night and decide to go for a bicycle ride, a hike, or a drive the next morning. Then I get up in the morning and am usually gone by 9:00 a.m. For example, last night I decided I wanted to drive to Ward today. This morning I left at 9:15, drove up Left Hand Canyon, back through Nederland and home.

field paying twice what i wanted, a great deal more than expected. I past my state exam and am in training. Doing great for myself, right?

Thanks, confused?

title: Cali Road Trip in February...
text:
I am really, really burn't out on this cold winter weather. Meanwhile, I have been curious about exploring the beach towns, and mountain towns of Cali for a long time. I know the weather may not be "hot" there, but it surely will be warmer, and it would be a nice change of scenery. I am posting in the platonic section because I am not looking for anything casual, but rather a deeper connection with a beautiful open minded girl or woman. So, I figure a week to two week long road trip, perhaps longer if we hit it off, would be an excellent way to get to know each other. 

I own an RV (which has two beds in it btw) so that part of this adventure is already spoken for. I also am a writer, and a producer, and this trip will "double" as a casual promotional trip, where we would visit local retailers in random towns. (this would take up about 2-3 hours of time, per day on random days. 

I am a conundrum of many colorful ideals and am only interested in someone with an amazingly open, beautiful mind. I am also pretty active. I enjoy Paddle Boarding, Rafting, Hiking, Biking, Long Boarding, Surfing, Yoga, Fishing, Camping and Disc Golfing as often as possible, so I am only also interested in someone who is active, and enjoys the outdoors. If you are interested in Ayuaschsa, or have experienced it, that will be an interesting topic, to share, I experienced it for the first time a year ago in Costa Rica which is my home away from home. If you are into Eastern Philosophy, or Shamanism, then we have a few more things in common. I am also a bit of a Conspiracy Theory Oracle...or as I like to say, instead of a "conspiracy theorist" I am a "Reality Querist" No rock goes un-turned... 

I also love live music and love to dance, so we will be dropping in on a show or two along the way. During the Spring and Summer Months, I love going to festivals, my range of music varies from, Bluegrass, to Side Trance, from Jam Bands to Reggae, and many genres in-between. I am 420 friendly BTW and I can only hang out with others who are because Cannabis is the industry my books, and products are wrapped around. I drink but very moderately, as in perhaps a 6 pack per week, or less... I eat healthy to, no red meat, and minimal processed food, open to vegans or vegetarians of course. 

I am intentionally being vague about who I am, or what kind of relationship I dream of, as the person I dream of is as much of an anomaly as I am, and she will most likely resonate on a deeper level just by the things I did mention in this add... Mystery is key to life, without it, I get bored, I hope you do to. I have plenty of pics to share once we trade an email or two to see if the vibes are there...

I was active duty Air Force for 7 years and now serve in the Air Force Reserves. I am also a full time culinary student at Johnson & Wales. My husband is a nurse practitioner and a hobby machinist. We both love anime and go to San Diego Comic Con every year. We also workout and go hiking and biking often. We are not religious and people who are make us uncomfortable.
About Me:
30 years old female, avid anime lover (ask me about my toy collection!), dog lover (I have 3), happily married for 8 years, I'm quiet at first and takes me a little while to become comfortable with other people (never sure whats okay to say to other people, I'm very sarcastic and I think I'm hilarious (I'm often told I'm a little too mean), I do not drink, smoke or do any drugs what so ever and would prefer a friend who is the same, I am obsessed with makeup and frequent Sephora and Ulta on a semi-regular basis. I enjoy going shopping and it has been a while since I've been able to have a girls shopping trip (malls, shopping centers, yardsales, second hand stores, etc). I do have children and am still not really comfortable around children yet ( I have no motherly instinct and borderline on being emotionally dead). I love cooking, baking and looking for and trying new recipes, I collect art from different comic conventions and am slightly obsessed with the Nightmare Before Christmas.
My favorite T.V shows are Charmed, Big Bang Theory, 2 Broke Girls, and Buffy the Vampire Slayer. My taste in music is very random (country, Jpop, Rock, classic rock, 80's music, mowtown, etc) I think that should do it for now. 
If I seem interesting, feel free to email me.

title: SPECIAL MESSAGE TO ALL WOMEN!
text: Super Bowl Sunday is here once again, and statistically it reigns as the one day each year with the highest incidence of domestic violence reported. There are cases every day which are not. Adrenalin, alcohol, testosterone and/or drugs can be a dangerous combination to women and children. You never have to be ANYONE'S victim, and you deserve better. If you know someone who may be in a potentially violent situation, please give them the number of the local women's helpline in case they need it. The number for the National Domestic Abuse Hotline is 800.799.SAFE (7233). Every woman has the right to live free of fear and we must help each other stay safe. "Respect yourself enough to accept nothing less from others." Thank you.

title: X-Country bicycle touring companion
text:
I know this is a long shot, but I'm looking for a woman (any age) to be a companion on a xc bicycle tour I am planning for this spring. It will be unsupported (we carry everything we need) and tentatively I'm planning on going south to north, but that's not set in stone. Thinking of Galveston Island, TX to upper Michigan via the Natchez Chase Trail to Tenn. starting around mid-to late April. I did a supported xc trip from Seaside, OR to Cape Code 2 years ago that took 58 days and have done several week-long unsupported trips over the last 20 years. I am not a super athlete, but fit enough to average 50-70 miles per day. Some longer some shorter depending on weather and some rest days. If you are reasonable fit, have your own equipment (touring bike, panniers, etc), have the time (1 month minimum), are easy going, and want an adventure let's chat and see if we might be compatible. Experience is helpful, but not completely necessary.
Pictures are from xc trip in 2014. Yes, I did have more than 2 shirts!
Thanks for reading.

title: Help Please
text:
I am seeking help! 

I love my husband, he is attractive and romantic when he wants to be. We live in a new gorgeous house, he let me get a dog and is working hard for both of us. I live a great life but there is a big problem... I have no desire for him, sexually that is. 

Like I said I love my husband. and when we were dating I had tons of sexual desire for him. (although we only saw each other about once a month, long distance relationship.) but right before we got married its like I just... dried up? 

I can't stress this enough, I DO LOVE HIM, and its not like I am attracted to other men, I don't even get turned on watching romantic movies anymore, I don't see anyone and get turned on anymore. I just don't get turned on anymore at all. 

He blames himself, thinks that he is not in good enough shape or if he was just more romantic or etc... and that's not it. He is very attractive, and IS VERY romantic. I feel like I lied to him. I feel like my body betrayed me. 

And he is getting more exasperated... sex is a need for men and I am not meeting this need for him. I am worried that he may soon try to find the attention that I am not giving to him somewhere else and that thought is killing me. 

Then again maybe I should let it happen... I don't know, If I did that I couldn't take the thought of him finding satisfaction somewhere else other than in me. 

I do try to give him sex when I can, but it is only like once or maybe twice a month. I don't know what is wrong with me... someone please give me advice.

title: Positive female interaction...
text:
So... lets get to it? 

I just went through a break up and I'm feeling all sorts of.. all over. I'm hurt, but will get better, and honestly kind of lonely.

It's something I've never had to handle on this scale before. I thought we could get married, and then.. nope. It's a very everything kind of feeling. Honestly, it was probably going to be this way, I had hope and thought people worked together and made love work. She thinks that means she dictates EVERYTHING and if that doesn't work, screaming and flipping out and making irrational decisions will. And it doesn't. And I'm done. Thankfully. A little relieved. 


Anyway, a few of my friends are now harassing me daily, to talk to girls. 

**at anyplace with any female that looks our direction- friends speaking** "please talk to him, at this point he needs any positive interaction with a female because he just escaped a succubus, and he needs to get some of his soul back" -- real thing said, several times. .. Please kill me now, if you're merciful dear 8lbs 6 oz new born baby Jesus! 

So that's my circle, and that's mostly me. A positive, glass half full kind of goof. I'm with it, down to earth, try to be funny when I can, and just moving on day to day at the moment. 


What I'm looking for? Whatever at this point. I'm not sure I can handle a relationship, I'm not sure I can handle friends with benefits. I'm not sure I could even do a 'fling'. well..... that last part is most likely a lie, I'm still a guy. I'm down, not dead. I'm not trying to wiggle at everything that moves though. 

I know I want something more than just a therapist to listen to me be sad. I want to flirt and have conversations. Maybe grab a beer, a sandwich, some wings, movie if you need someone so you don't go alone. I don't do horror movies though, not gonna happen. Even if you pout and beg and try to make little innocent but devious faces. I'm not going. lol 

I guess friends are right, I'm not broken, and this really f*cking hurts.. I could definitely use positive female interaction. 


If you're interested, let me know. Be with it, normal, working, paying bills, etc. I don't want crazy. I'm not a feather, I'm not a 300lbs slob either, no offense. Just fall somewhere normal is all I'm asking. 

Kind of long, thanks for sticking it out. - Drew

title: Seeking honest friendship and fun
text:
So here's the deal. I am a relatively normal guy with a good life. However, I've moved around a few times, and in the last several locations, I've been at the top of the organization I work for. Because, perhaps, I am old-fashioned, I don't build real friendships with employees, so it has been hard to find real, true, friends outside of home and work. This leaves a bit of a gaping hole in my life, and I'm trying everything I can to fill the gap.

I tend to build better friendships with women, and always have. So here I am, somewhat embarrassingly, posting on Craigslist. This is not a veiled attempt at finding a lover. I'm a happily married guy with the coolest kids on the planet and am really seeking a platonic friend.

I'm in my mid to late forties (see what I did there), politically progressive, well-read, educated, interested in just about everything you're not supposed to talk about: Politics, religion, science, literature, movies, music, etc. . . I like to stay in shape, and was in the service a million years ago.

I'd like to meet someone who likes to talk about Life, the Universe, and Everything: What you fear, what brings you joy, what makes you smile, and what makes you cry, how do you deal with it, how can you make it better.

If we were to hit it off on email, I'd love to have coffee, lunch, a finely hand-crafted microbrew, or a classic cocktail, and get to know each other better.

If you are not interested, and just feeling generous with your time -- I'd love to hear your thoughts on how to meet friends outside of work and home -- especially if you are not single, and aren't looking for a hookup.

Thanks for your time. My fingers are crossed.

title: Verbose Romantic Seeking ...
text: I'm looking for someone to write old fashioned love letters to. I have what seems like an infinite supply of words to say to a distant beautiful woman I've never seen. A woman who loves wine, and coffee, and music, and rich colors and gorgeous views. Someone who reads real books with pages. Someone who cries in movies, appreciates history, takes chances and closes her eyes when something wonderful happens, to keep it from evaporating. She's had to have been through some tragedy and pain, so that she knows what joy and rapture are. Someone who trusts happiness, loves naps and knows that in the center of everything is a good place. I have a great life. I'm successful and healthy, I'm a kind, funny person, devoted father, etc. But there is a starving part of me that can only be fulfilled by having a person in my life to whom I can start emails with "I thought of you many times today..." -- but who I will probably never actually meet.

title: Young Men's Nudist Group
text:
I'm putting together a new social nudist group in Denver for younger nudists or guys who might be interested. 

I'm 31, white active and fit. I've been a nudist for 10 years. I love the bonding and brotherhood aspect. Our group is focused on young men under 45. 

I've formed a group on meetup called Denver young men's nudist brotherhood. Look it up on there or shoot me an email. 

The group is all about naked parties, game nights, drinking watching a game or whatever. Just laid back activities at a private home where we just chill naked. Open to all sexualities since it's not a sex group. But tantric massage or edging could be possibilities for gatherings. Cool with 420. 

Our next meetup is Sunday for a Super Bowl Party in the buff. 

So if you're a nudist, naturalist, exhibitionist or wanted to try it but couldn't find dudes your age this group is for you.
